intro: Pipturus ruber, commonly known as the redleaf fern, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that turn a vibrant red during the dry season. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The botanical features of Pipturus ruber make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
